verses.text: کُلُوا وَ اشْرَبُوا هَنِيئاً بِمَا أَسْلَفْتُمْ‌ فِي‌ الْأَيَّامِ‌ الْخَالِيَةِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [به آنان گویند:] بخورید و بیاشامید، گوارایتان باد به سبب اعمالی که در ایام گذشته انجام دادید؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بخوريد و بياشاميد، گوارا باد شما را. اينها پاداش اعمالى است كه در ايام گذشته به جاى مى‌آورده‌ايد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بخوريد و بنوشيد، گوارايتان باد، به [پاداش‌] آنچه در روزهاى گذشته پيش فرستاده‌ايد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بخوريد و بنوشيد، گواراتان باد، به [پاداش‌] آنچه در روزهاى گذشته انجام داديد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (و خطاب رسد که) از طعام و شرابهای لذیذ و گوارای بهشتی هر چه خواهید تناول کنید، شما را گوارا باد، که این پاداش اعمال ایّام گذشته دنیاست که (بر امروز خویش) پیش فرستادید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در برابر کارهائی که در روزگاران گذشته (ی دنیا) انجام می‌داده‌اید. بخورید و بنوشید، گوارا باد! [[«هَنِیئاً»: گوارا. گوارا باد. «بِمَا»: در مقابل چیزی که. در برابر کارهائی که. «أَسْلَفْتُمْ»: پیشاپیش فرستاده‌اید و تقدیم داشته‌اید (نگا: یونس / 30). «الْخَالِیَةِ»: گذشته. مراد روزگاران دنیا است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [به آنان گویند] به خاطر آنچه در روزگاران گذشته انجام داده‌اید، بخورید و بیاشامید گوارا

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (و به آنان گفته می‌شود:) بخورید و بیاشامید گوارا در برابر اعمالی که در ایّام گذشته انجام دادید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بخورید و بنوشید گوارا باد شما را بدانچه گذشت از شما در روزگاران گذشته‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بخوريد و بياشاميد، نوش و گوارا، به پاداش آنچه در روزگار گذشته پيش فرستاديد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (به آنان گفته شود:) «به گوارایی بخورید و بیاشامید، به سبب آن چه در زمان‌های گذشته از پیش فرستادید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (And told:) "Eat and drink to your fill as reward for (good) deeds you had done in days of yore."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Eat and drink with pleasure – the reward of what you sent ahead, in the past days.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'Eat and drink with wholesome appetite for that you did long ago, in the days gone by.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Eat and drink with benefit for that which ye sent on beforehand in dayspast.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Eat and drink at ease for that which you have sent on before you in days past!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Eat and drink merrily for what you did in the days gone by.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (They will be told): “Eat and drink with good cheer as a reward for the good deeds you did in the days that have passed by.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Eat and drink at ease for that which you have sent on before you in days past!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (And it will be said unto those therein): Eat and drink at ease for that which ye sent on before you in past days.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [He will be told]: ‘Enjoy your food and drink, for what you had sent in advance in past days [for your future life].’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (It will be said): 'Eat and drink with a good appetite because of what you did in days long passed'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Such people will be told, "Eat and drink with pleasure as the reward for what you did in the past".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Eat and drink pleasantly for what you did beforehand in the days gone by.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kuloo waishraboo haneean bima aslaftum fee alayyami alkhaliyati

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We shall say to him, "Eat and drink joyfully as a reward for the good deeds you did in days gone by."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Eat ye and drink ye, with full satisfaction; because of the (good) that ye sent before you, in the days that are gone!"

verses.text: وَ أَمَّا مَنْ‌ أُوتِيَ‌ کِتَابَهُ‌ بِشِمَالِهِ‌ فَيَقُولُ‌ يَا لَيْتَنِي‌ لَمْ‌ أُوتَ‌ کِتَابِيَهْ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اما کسی که پرونده اعمالش را به دست چپش دهند، می گوید: ای کاش پرونده ام را دریافت نمی کردم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما آن كس كه نامه اعمالش را به دست چپش دهند مى‌گويد: اى كاش نامه مرا به دست من نداده بودند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اما كسى كه كارنامه‌اش بدست چپ او داده شود، گويد: اى كاش نامه‌ام به من داده نمى‌شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اما كسى كه كارنامه‌اش به دست چپش داده شود، گويد: «اى كاش كتابم را دريافت نكرده بودم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اما آن کس که کتاب عملش به دست چپ دهند (با کمال شرمندگی و اندوه) گوید: ای کاش نامه مرا به من نمی‌دادند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و امّا کسی که نامه‌ی اعمالش به دست چپش داده شود، می‌گوید: ای کاش هرگز نامه‌ی اعمالم به من داده نمی‌شد! [[«شِمَال»: دست چپ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اما کسی که کارنامه‌اش به دست چپش داده شود، [سوکمندانه‌] گوید ای کاش کارنامه‌ام به من داده نمی‌شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا کسی که نامه اعمالش را به دست چپش بدهند می‌گوید: «ای کاش هرگز نامه اعمالم را به من نمی‌دادند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اما آنکه داده شد نامه خویش را به چپش گوید کاشکیم داده نمی‌شدم نامه خویش را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اما آن كه كارنامه او به دست چپش داده شود پس [با بد حالى‌] گويد: اى كاش كارنامه‌ام به من داده نمى‌شد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اما کسی که کتابش به دست چپش داده شود، پس گوید: «ای کاش کتابم به من داده نمی‌شد.»

translations.text: But whosoever gets his ledger in his left hand, will say: "Would that I were never given my ledger,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And whoever is given his book in his left hand – he will say, “Alas, if only my account were not given to me!”

translations.text: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he shall say, 'Would that I had not been given my book

translations.text: Then as to him who shall be vouchsafed his book in his left hand, he shall say: Oh! would that I had not been vouchsafed my book.

translations.text: But as for him who will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "I wish that I had not been given my Record!

translations.text: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, “I wish I was never given my book.

translations.text: But as for him who will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "I wish that I had not been given my Record!"

translations.text: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, ‘I wish I had not been given my book,

translations.text: But, he who is given his book in his left hand will say: 'Woe to me, would that my book had not been given to me!

translations.text: و آنچه نمى‌بينيد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آنچه نمی‌بینید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و سوگند می‌خورم به آنچه نمی‌بینید! [[«بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ ... وَ مَا لا تُبْصِرُونَ»: مراد از دیدنیها و نادنیها، همه مخلوقات و موجودات است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به آنچه نمی‌بینید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آنچه نمی‌بینید،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آنچه نبینید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنچه نمى‌بينيد،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (نیز) به آنچه نمی‌بینید،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And what you do not see,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And by oath of those you do not see.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and by that you do not see,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And that which ye see not.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And by whatsoever you see not,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And by what you do not see.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and by what you do not see,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And by whatsoever you see not,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And all that ye see not

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and what you do not see:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and all that you do not see,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And what you do not see

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and what you do not see

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And that which you do not see.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama la tubsiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: as well as all that you cannot see:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And what ye see not,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید این قرآن، گفتار فرستاده ای بزرگوار است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه اين سخن فرستاده‌اى بزرگوار است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه اين [قرآن‌] قطعا گفتار فرستاده‌اى بزرگوار است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه [قرآن‌] قطعاً گفتار فرستاده‌اى بزرگوار است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که قرآن به حقیقت (وحی خدا و) کلام رسول بزرگواری است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این (قرآن از سوی خدا آمده است و) گفتاری است (که) از (زبان) پیغمبر بزرگواری (به نام محمّد، پخش و تبلیغ می‌شود). [[«إِنَّهُ»: قرآن. «رَسُولٍ»: مراد پیغمبر اسلام است که از سوی خداوند مبلّغِ کلام آسمانی است (نگا: حاقّه / 43).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که آن [قرآن‌] برخوانده فرستاده گرامی است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که این قرآن گفتار رسول بزرگواری است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که آن است همانا سخن پیمبری گرامی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه اين [قرآن‌] گفتار فرستاده‌اى است بزرگوار- رسول اكرم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (که) این (قرآن) به‌راستی بی‌گمان گفتار فرستاده‌ای بزرگوار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That this is indeed the word of the noble Messenger,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: This Qur’an is the speech of Allah with a gracious Noble Messenger.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: it is the speech of a noble Messenger.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: That it is surely the speech brought by messenger honourable.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: That this is verily the word of an honoured Messenger [i.e. Jibrael (Gabriel) or Muhammad SAW which he has brought from Allah].

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is the speech of a noble messenger.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: that this is the speech of an honourable Messenger,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: That this is verily the word of an honored Messenger.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That it is indeed the speech of an illustrious messenger.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: it is indeed the speech of a noble apostle

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: that this is the speech of a noble Messenger.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: because the Quran is certainly the word of a reverent messenger.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely, it is the Word brought by an honored Apostle,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahu laqawlu rasoolin kareemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: most surely, this is the word brought by a noble messenger,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That this is verily the word of an honoured messenger;

verses.text: وَ مَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ‌ شَاعِرٍ قَلِيلاً مَا تُؤْمِنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آن گفتار یک شاعر نیست، ولی جز اندکی ایمان نمی آورید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه سخن شاعرى. چه اندك ايمان مى‌آوريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آن گفتار يك شاعر نيست. اما كمتر ايمان مى‌آوريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آن گفتار شاعرى نيست [كه‌] كمتر [به آن‌] ايمان داريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن نه سخن شاعری (و گفتار خیالی و موهومی) است (گر چه) اندکی از شما مردم به آن ایمان می‌آورید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و سخن هیچ شاعری نیست (چنان که شما گمان می‌برید. اصلاً) شما کمتر ایمان می‌آورید (و به دنبال حق و حقیقت می‌افتید). [[«قَلِیلاً مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ»: (نگا: بقره / 88).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سخن هیچ شاعری نیست، چه اندک ایمان می‌آورید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و گفته شاعری نیست، امّا کمتر ایمان می‌آورید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیست گفتار شاعری به کمی ایمان آورید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اين سخن شاعرى نيست، چه اندك ايمان مى‌آوريد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آن گفتار شاعری نیست‌. (چه) کم است آنچه ایمان می‌آورید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And not the word of a poet. How little is it that you believe!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And it is not the speech of a poet; how little do you believe!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It is not the speech of a poet (little do you believe)

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And it is not the speech of a poet. Little it is that ye believe

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: It is not the word of a poet, little is that you believe!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And it is not the speech of a poet—little do you believe.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: not the speech of a poet. Little do you believe!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: It is not the word of a poet, little is that you believe!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It is not poet's speech - little is it that ye believe!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and it is not the speech of a poet. Little is the faith that you have!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It is not the speech of a poet little do you believe

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is not the word of a poet but only a few of you have faith,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And it is not the word of a poet; little is it that you believe;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama huwa biqawli shaAAirin qaleelan ma tuminoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: it is not the word of a poet -- how little you believe! --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: It is not the word of a poet: little it is ye believe!

verses.text: وَ لاَ بِقَوْلِ‌ کَاهِنٍ‌ قَلِيلاً مَا تَذَکَّرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و گفتار کاهن هم نیست، ولی جز اندکی متذکّر نمی شوید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و نيز سخن كاهنى نيست. چه اندك پند مى‌گيريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و نه گفتار كاهنى. چه اندك متذكر مى‌شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و نه گفتار كاهنى [كه‌] كمتر [از آن‌] پند مى‌گيريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و نه حرف کاهن غیبگوست (گر چه) اندکی از شما مردم متذکر حقایق آن می‌شوید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و گفته‌ی هیچ غیبگو و کاهنی نیست. اصلاً شما کمتر پند می‌گیرید (و یادآور حق و حقیقت می‌گردید، و درست و نادرست را فرق می‌نهید). [[«قَلِیلاً مَّا تَذَکَّرُونَ»: (نگا: اعراف / 3، نمل / 62، غافر / 58).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سخن هیچ کاهنی نیست، چه اندک پند می‌گیرید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و نه گفته کاهنی، هر چند کمتر متذکّر می‌شوید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نه گفتار پیش‌گوئی به کمی یاد آورید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و سخن كاهنى- پيشگو يا اخترگو- هم نيست، چه اندك پند مى‌گيريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و نه گفتار کاهنی است. (چه) کم است آنچه متذکر می‌شوید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer. Little is it that you reflect!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Nor is it the speech of a soothsayer; how little do you ponder!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: nor the speech of a soothsayer (little do you remember).

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Nor is it the speech of a sooth- sayer. Little are ye admonished.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer (or a foreteller), little is that you remember!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Nor is it the speech of a soothsayer—little do you take heed.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Nor is this the speech of a soothsayer. Little do you reflect!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer, little is that you remember!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nor diviner's speech - little is it that ye remember!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Nor is it the speech of a soothsayer. Little is the admonition that you take!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: nor is it the speech of a soothsayer little do you remember.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: nor is it the work of a soothsayer but only a few of you take heed.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little is it that you mind.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala biqawli kahinin qaleelan ma tathakkaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer -- how little you reflect!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer: little admonition it is ye receive.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: نازل شده از سوی پروردگار جهانیان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از جانب پروردگار جهانيان نازل شده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [بلكه‌] نازل شده از جانب پروردگار جهانيان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [پيام‌] فرودآمده‌اى است از جانب پروردگار جهانيان.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این قرآن تنزیل خدای عالمیان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (بلکه کلامی است که) از جانب پروردگار جهانیان نازل شده است. [[«تَنزِیلٌ»: (نگا: شعراء / 192، سجده / 2، یس / 5).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و فرو فرستاده‌ای از سوی پروردگار جهانیان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: کلامی است که از سوی پروردگار عالمیان نازل شده است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: فرستادنی است از پروردگار عالمیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: فروفرستاده‌اى است از پروردگار جهانيان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (پیام) فرود آمده‌ای است از جانب پروردگار جهانیان.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It has been sent down by the Lord of all the worlds.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Sent down by the Lord Of The Creation.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: A sending down from the Lord of all Being.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: It is a Revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: This is the Revelation sent down from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It has been revealed by the Lord of the Universe.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: This is the revelation sent down from the Lord of all that exists.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Gradually sent down from the Lord of all the worlds.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (It is) a sending down from the Lord of all the Worlds.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Tanzeelun min rabbi alAAalameena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It is a revelation sent down by the Sustainer of the Universe:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (This is) a Message sent down from the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.text: وَ لَوْ تَقَوَّلَ‌ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ‌ الْأَقَاوِيلِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر [او] پاره ای از گفته ها را به دروغ بر ما می بست،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر پيامبر پاره‌اى سخنان را به افترا بر ما مى‌بست،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر او حتى يك كلمه [از پيش خود] بر ما دروغ مى‌بست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر [او] پاره‌اى گفته‌ها بر ما بسته بود،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر (محمّد صلّی اللّه علیه و آله و سلّم) از دروغ به ما برخی سخنان را می‌بست،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر پیغمبر پاره‌ای سخنان را به دروغ بر ما می‌بست. [[«الأَقَاوِیلِ»: جمع أَقْوال، و آن جمع قَوْل است همچون اَبابیت جمع اَبْیات، و اَناعیم جمع اَنْعام. این واژه بیشتر به سخنان دروغین گفته می‌شود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر بر ما سخنانی می‌بست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اگر او سخنی دروغ بر ما می‌بست،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر می‌بست بر ما پاره سخنان را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر وى برخى سخنان را بر ما برمى‌بافت،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اگر (او) پاره‌ای از گفته‌ها(ی ناروا) را بر ما همی بربندد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Had he attributed falsely any words to Us,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And had he fabricated just one matter upon Us –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Had he invented against Us any sayings,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And if he had forged concerning us some discourses.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And if he (Muhammad SAW) had forged a false saying concerning Us (Allah),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Had he falsely attributed some statements to Us.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And if he [i.e., the Prophets] had forged this Discourse and thereafter ascribed it to Us,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And if he had forged a false saying concerning Us,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And if he had invented false sayings concerning Us,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Had he faked any sayings in Our name,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Had he invented sayings against Us,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Had Muhammad invented some words against Us,.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And if he had fabricated against Us some of the sayings,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaw taqawwala AAalayna baAAda alaqaweeli

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: if he had invented any lies about Us,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And if the messenger were to invent any sayings in Our name,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ما او را به شدت می گرفتیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: با قدرت او را فرومى‌گرفتيم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ما دست راست او را مى‌گرفتيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: دست راستش را سخت مى‌گرفتيم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: محققا ما او را (به قهر و انتقام) از یمینش می‌گرفتیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما دست راست او را می‌گرفتیم. [[«الْیَمِینِ»: دست راست. مراد دست راست پیغمبر است (نگا: روح المعانی، روح البیان، کشّاف). منظور جلوگیری از تعدّی به کلام خدا است. همان گونه که می‌گویند: جلو دستش را بگیرید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: دست راستش را می‌گرفتیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما او را با قدرت می‌گرفتیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هر آینه می‌گرفتیم از او به دست راست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه او را به دست راست- كنايه از قوت و توانايى يا سختى و شدت- مى‌گرفتيم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: با قدرت (بی‌نهایت‌)، (وحی ربانی را) از او برمی‌گیریم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We would have seized him by his right hand,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We would have definitely taken revenge from him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We would have seized him by the right hand,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: We surely had lain hold of him by the right hand.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: We surely should have seized him by his right hand (or with power and might),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We would have seized him by the right arm.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We would surely have seized him by the right hand,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We surely would have seized him by his right hand,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We assuredly had taken him by the right hand

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We would have surely seized him by the right hand

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We would have seized him by the right hand

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We would have seized him by the right hand;

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We would have caught hold of him by his right hand

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: We would certainly have seized him by the right hand,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Laakhathna minhu bialyameeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We would indeed have seized him by his right hand

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We should certainly seize him by his right hand,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس رگ قلبش را پاره می کردیم؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سپس رگ دلش را پاره مى‌كرديم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس شريان قلبش را قطع مى‌كرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سپس رگ قلبش را پاره مى‌كرديم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و رگ و تینش را قطع می‌کردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس رگ دلش را پاره می‌کردیم. [[«الْوَتِینَ»: شاهرگ قلب که خون را به تمام اعضاء بدن می‌رساند و اگر قطع شود مرگ انسان آنی و حتمی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس شاهرگش را قطع می‌کردیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس رگ قلبش را قطع می‌کردیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و سپس می‌بریدیم از او رگ گردن را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس رگ جان- دل- او را مى‌بريديم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس رگ (زندگی وحیانی)اش را پاره می‌کنیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then cut off his aorta,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then would have cut off his heart’s artery.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then We would surely have cut his life-vein

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And then severed his life-vein.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And then certainly should have cut off his life artery (Aorta),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then slashed his lifeline.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and then severed his life vein;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And then We certainly would have cut off Al-Watin from him,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And then severed his life-artery,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and then cut off his aorta,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: then, We would surely have cut from him the aorta (vein)

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and cut-off his main artery.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then We would certainly have cut off his aorta.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma laqataAAna minhu alwateena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and would indeed have cut his life-vein,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We should certainly then cut off the artery of his heart:

verses.text: فَمَا مِنْکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ‌ حَاجِزِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در آن صورت هیچ کدام از شما مانع از عذاب او نبود،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و هيچ يك از شما را توان آن نبود كه مانع شود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه احدى از شما مدافع او نبود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هيچ يك از شما مانع از [عذاب‌] او نمى‌شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و شما هیچ یک بر دفاع از او قادر نبودید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و کسی از شما نمی‌توانست مانع (این کار ما در باره‌ی) او شود (و مرگ را از او باز دارد). [[«حَاجِزِینَ»: جمع حاجِز، به معنی مانِع و رادِع. بازدارندگان. جلوگیری کنندگان. خبر (مَا) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و هیچ‌یک از شما مدافع او نبود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هیچ کس از شما نمی‌توانست از (مجازات) او مانع شود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نبودش کسی از شما نگهدارنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس هيچ يك از شما بازدارنده [عذاب‌] از او نيست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس هیچ یک از شما مانع از (عذاب) او نیست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And not one of you would have been able to stop (Us).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then none among you would be his saviour.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and not one of you could have defended him.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And not one of you would have withheld us from punishing him.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And none of you could withhold Us from (punishing) him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And none of you could have restrained Us from him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and not one of you would have been able to withhold Us from doing so.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And none of you could have prevented it from him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And not one of you could have held Us off from him.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and none of you could have held Us off from him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: not one of you could have prevented it from him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: None of you would be able to prevent Us from doing this to him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And not one of you could have withheld Us from him.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fama minkum min ahadin AAanhu hajizeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and none of you could have held Us off from him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nor could any of you withhold him (from Our wrath).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید این قرآن، وسیله پند و تذکری برای پرهیزکاران است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و قرآن براى پرهيزگاران پندى است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا اين [قرآن‌] تذكارى براى پرهيزكاران است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در حقيقت، [قرآن‌] تذكارى براى پرهيزگاران است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و این قرآن به حقیقت پند و تذکر پرهیزکاران عالم است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مسلّماً قرآن پند و اندرز پرهیزگاران است. [[«تَذْکِرَةٌ»: (نگا: طه / 3).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آن پندآموزی برای پرهیزگاران است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آن مسلّماً تذکری برای پرهیزگاران است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا آن است یادآوریی برای پرهیزکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه اين [قرآن‌] ياد و پندى است براى پرهيزگاران.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان (قرآن) یادواره‌ای برای پرهیزگاران است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is really a reminder for those who fear God and follow the straight path.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed this Qur’an is an advice for the pious.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely it is a Reminder to the godfearing;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily it is an Admonition Unto the God-fearing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, this Quran is a Reminder for the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Surely, it is a message for the righteous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely it is a Good Counsel for the God-fearing.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, this is a Reminder for those who have Taqwa.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! it is a warrant unto those who ward off (evil).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed it is a reminder for the Godwary.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, it is a Reminder to those who fear Allah,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Quran is certainly a reminder for the pious ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely it is a reminder for those who guard (against evil).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainnahu latathkiratun lilmuttaqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And surely it is an admonition to the God-fearing.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But verily this is a Message for the Allah-fearing.

verses.text: وَ إِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ‌ أَنَ‌ مِنْکُمْ‌ مُکَذِّبِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما به یقین می دانیم که از میان شما انکارکنندگانی هست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما مى‌دانيم كه از ميان شما كسانى هستند كه تكذيب مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما بى‌ترديد مى‌دانيم كه برخى از شما تكذيب كنندگان [آن‌] هستيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ما به راستى مى‌دانيم كه از [ميان‌] شما تكذيب‌كنندگانى هستند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و البته ما می‌دانیم که شما برخی تکذیب آن می‌کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما قطعاً می‌دانیم که برخی از شما (قرآن را) تکذیب می‌کنند. [[«مُکَذِّبِینَ»: تکذیب کنندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما به یقین می‌دانیم که از میان شما تکذیب‌کنندگانی هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما می‌دانیم که بعضی از شما (آن را) تکذیب می‌کنید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا دانیم که از شما است تکذیب‌کنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه ما مى‌دانيم كه از شما تكذيب‌كنانى هستند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و ما به‌راستی می‌دانیم که از (میان) شما همواره تکذیب‌کنندگانی هستند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We certainly know that some among you do deny it.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed We know that some among you are deniers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: but We know that some of you will cry lies.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily We! We know that some among you are beliers thereof.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, We know that there are some among you that belie (this Quran). [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 29, Page 68]

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We know that some of you will reject it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We certainly know that some among you will give the lie to it,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, We know that there are some among you that deny.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! We know that some among you will deny (it).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed We know that there are some among you who deny [it].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We know that there are some among you who will belie.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We certainly know that some of you have rejected it

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely We know that some of you are rejecters.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna lanaAAlamu anna minkum mukaththibeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We know very well that there are some among you who reject Our signs --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We certainly know that there are amongst you those that reject (it).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و این انکار قطعاً مایه حسرت کافران است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و قرآن كافران را مايه حسرت است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همين [تكذيب‌] مايه‌ى حسرتى براى كافران است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آن واقعاً بر كافران حسرتى است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و تکذیبش عاقبت مایه ندامت کافران است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آخر قرآن، مایه‌ی حسرت و سبب اندوه کافران است. [[«إِنَّهُ»: این که قرآن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آن [پیام‌]، مایه حسرتی بر کافران است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آن مایه حسرت کافران است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا آن است دریغی بر کافران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آن همواره بر کافران بی‌گمان حسرتی است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is surely the nemesis of unbelievers.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed it is a despair for the disbelievers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely it is a sorrow to the unbelievers;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily it shall be an occasion of anguish Unto the infidels.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed it (this Quran) will be an anguish for the disbelievers (on the Day of Resurrection).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And it is surely a source of grief for the unbelievers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and surely it will be a cause of regret for the unbelievers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed it will be an anguish for the disbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! it is indeed an anguish for the disbelievers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And indeed it will be a [matter of] regret for the faithless.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, it is a sorrow to the unbelievers

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and (on the Day of Judgment) this will be a great source of regret for the unbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely it is a great grief to the unbelievers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainnahu lahasratun AAala alkafireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: it will be a source of bitter regret for those who deny the truth --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But truly (Revelation) is a cause of sorrow for the Unbelievers.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بی تردید این قرآن، حقّی یقینی است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آن سخن حق و يقين است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اين [قرآن‌]، بى‌شبهه، حقيقت ثابت است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اين [قرآن‌]، بى‌شبهه، حقيقتى يقينى است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و این حق و حقیقت محض است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: قرآن، یقینِ راستین (و حق و حقیقت فرو فرستاده‌ی جهان آفرین) است. [[«حَقُّ الْیَقِینِ»: (نگا: واقعه / 95).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آن [پیام‌]، حق‌الیقین است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آن یقین خالص است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا آن است در حقّ یقین‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همانا آن حق اليقين است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و این (قرآن) به‌راستی بی‌شبهه (در راستای) حق یقین است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And He, He is indeed the ultimate Reality.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed it is a certain Truth.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: yet indeed it is the truth of certainty.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily it is the truth of assured certainty.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And Verily, it (this Quran) is an absolute truth with certainty.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Yet it is the absolute truth.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Certainly it is a Truth of absolute certainty.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, it (this Qur'an) is an absolute truth with certainty.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! it is absolute truth.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is indeed certain truth.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: yet it is a certain truth.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This is the Truth beyond any doubt.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely it is the true certainty

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainnahu lahaqqu alyaqeeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: it is the indubitable truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But verily it is Truth of assured certainty.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگارت تسبیح گوی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگار بزرگت تسبيح بگوى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگار بزرگت تسبيح گوى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس به [پاس‌] نام پروردگار بزرگت تسبيح گوى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس به نام خدای بزرگوار خود تسبیح گوی و آن را به ستایش یاد کن.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: حال که چنین است. با ذکر نام پروردگار بزرگوار خود، خدا را تسبیح و تقدیس کن. [[«فَسَبِّحْ»: (نگا: آل‌عمران / 41، حجر / 98، طه / 130). «بِاسْمِ»: به وسیله نام. با بردن نام.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگار بزرگ خود تسبیح گوی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: حال که چنین است به نام پروردگار بزرگت تسبیح گوی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس تسبیح گوی به نام پروردگارت آن بزرگ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگار بزرگت تسبيح گوى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس به (پاس) نام پروردگار بزرگت (او را) تسبیح گوی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So glorify your Lord, the most supreme.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), proclaim the purity of your Lord, the Greatest.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then magnify the Name of thy Lord, the All-mighty.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore hallow thou the name of thy Lord, the Mighty.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Magnificent.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So glorify the name of your Lord Most Great.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So glorify the name of thy Tremendous Lord.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So celebrate the Name of your Lord, the All-supreme.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Exalt the Name of your Lord, the Great.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), glorify the name of your Lord, the Great One.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore-glorify the name of your Lord, the Great.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fasabbih biismi rabbika alAAatheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Almighty.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So glorify the name of thy Lord Most High.
